meanings.sent1: I will redistill the water to make it pure.
meanings.sent2: The scientist decided to redistill the liquid for better results.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to redistill the sauce after adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: She had to redistill her thoughts before making a decision.
meanings.sent5: The process of redistilling the perfume enhanced its fragrance.

meanings.definition: To purify or concentrate by distillation.
meanings.sent1: The distiller will redistill the alcohol to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: They had to redistill the medicine to remove impurities.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to redistill the potion for a more potent effect.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like redistilling her resolve to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to redistill the colors of the rainbow.

meanings.sent1: The solution will redistill when heated.
meanings.sent2: The mixture needs to redistill to separate the components.
meanings.sent3: The idea seemed to redistill in his mind as he pondered it further.
meanings.sent4: Her memories redistilled in her dreams, becoming clearer.
meanings.sent5: The essence of the flower seemed to redistill in the evening air.
